body:
So now you have to hold an extremely volatile asset over a year or two year span to break even or make money (given you bought on the way up)?

What a successful trade.
Well actually, I bought at 2k, so no. Only an idiot buys at ATH.
author: Tricky_Troll

body: That's because they are new, inexperienced "investors" who probably couldn't even tell you what blockchain is. Hence, "idiots" as far as cryptocurrencies and investing goes.
author: Tricky_Troll

body:
What are you talking about? I never put a time scale on this...

Come back in a year or two and then you can tell me whether or not this happened.
author: Tricky_Troll

body:
You don't have to invest in BTC to have exposure to block-chain though.

But yes, I definitely agree about the "idiot" part.

>Only an idiot buys at ATH

Not how I remember everyone acting. People screamed "FUD" and "HODL" and "buy the dip" all the way down from 20K.

I was told I would "be sorry" for not buying at 15K, 13K, 11K, 9K.
Sure. That's why most of my holdings are in Ethereum or ERC20 tokens on the ethereum network because smart contracts and DApps have a place in the future while Bitcoin might not.
author: Tricky_Troll
